result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Killeen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick J. Killeen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick J. Killeen was found guilty of Election Fraud-Voting by Disqualified Person, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).
  • Patrick J. Killeen was found guilty of Election Fraud-Voting by Disqualified Person, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Cooperate with agent.
Defendant to inform prospective new employers the specifics of his past convictions.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.

records.addlTxt: From Attorney Scholz to Court regarding sentence credit received and filed.

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 19 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions to apply to probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain suitable employment
-Defendant to inform prospective new employers the specifics of his past convictions

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1YEAR, concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain suitable employment
-Defendant to inform prospective new employers the specifics of his past convictions

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his  civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with Attorney Amy C Scholz.  Joseph C. Mathy for Bruce Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Discussion was held regarding the credits for the defendant.  Matter is adjourned to November 24, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with Attorney Amy C Scholz.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Upon Motion of the State, this count is DISMISSED.  The Court ordered this count DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Matter is set for sentencing on October 28, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared, via telephone, for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter set for a Plea Hearing on October 1, 2015 at 8:30am in Judge Conen's court, Br. 30.  Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 08-10-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (7-6-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Patrick J. Killeen in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/26/15 @ 1:30 PM
